traits.respected_council_member: Described as a respected member of the council who is himself looking for the kingdom of God.
traits.bold_request: Gathers courage to ask Pilate for Jesus’s body after the crucifixion.
traits.burial_actions: Buys a linen shroud, takes Jesus down, wraps him, and lays him in a tomb hewn out of rock, rolling a stone against the entrance.

traits.rich_disciple: Called a rich man from Arimathea who had also become a disciple of Jesus.
traits.own_new_tomb: Places Jesus in his own new tomb, which he had hewn in the rock, and rolls a great stone to the door.
traits.role_in_guarding_narrative: His tomb becomes the locus for the guard and sealing of the stone, central to Matthew’s empty-tomb polemic.

traits.good_and_righteous: Characterized as a good and righteous man who had not consented to the council’s plan and action.
traits.waiting_for_kingdom: Also said to be waiting expectantly for the kingdom of God.
traits.careful_burial: Takes the body down, wraps it in a linen cloth, and lays it in a rock-hewn tomb where no one had ever been laid.

traits.secret_disciple: Identified as a disciple of Jesus, though a secret one for fear of the Jews.
traits.collaboration_with_nicodemus: Works together with Nicodemus, who brings a mixture of myrrh and aloes, to prepare and bury Jesus according to Jewish burial customs.
traits.garden_tomb: Uses a new tomb in a garden near the place of crucifixion, in which no one had yet been laid.
